document_data.name: Outlands
document_data.shape-size-GW: One infinite layer, but with a definite center
document_data.magical-GW: Limited to dead: magic fades toward the center
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Concordant Domain of the Outlands''', also known as '''Concordant Opposition''', was the center of the [[Great Wheel cosmology|Great Wheel]] of [[Outer Planes]]. It connected to all other Outer Planes and was truly [[neutral]] in alignment. '''Godsland''', and '''Friendly Opposition'''. and the [[Fugue Plane]] when that cosmology became popular. Both of these planes survived the [[Spellplague]] to float in the [[Astral Sea]].

The Outlands was the exception to many of the rules governing the Outer Planes, the first being its lack of alignment or true neutrality. It was an infinite plane, yet it had a definite center (the [[Spire]] with [[Sigil]] on top). The properties of all the other Outer Planes were mixed together in the Outlands. Good, Evil, Law, and Chaos existed here in all their forms, but they were less able to affect each other due to the neutralizing effect of this plane.
document_data.Description: While there was no sun in the Outlands, the plane still had day and night cycles.
document_data.Geography:
This plane defied description by changing the perception of those who entered, becoming a completely new and yet familiar plane with each visit. Typically on the first visit the plane appeared as a larger version of the visitor's homeland. (A farmer would see vast farmland, a scribe would see a huge library for example.) Subsequent visits would reveal a different face but demesnes remained in the same spatial location—a city on one visit might be a forest with inhabitable trees on the next—chaotic variation but with the same order and placement. Deities could not fully control what visitors saw and heard in their realms, but they could influence the appearance to represent their proclivities.

The Outlands had a neutralizing effect on the randomness of weapons and spells, reducing all healing and damage to the minimum possible while having no effect on strength or magical bonuses. In addition to this, magic itself was gradually neutralized as you approached the center of the plane (which appeared as a huge mountain, tree, fountain, tornado, tower, column, etc.). At about {{SI|1000|mi|k|long=yes}} out, high-level spells ceased to function. Every {{SI|100|mi|k|long=yes}} or so, lower level spells would begin to fail, until finally at {{SI|200|mi|k|long=yes}} from the center even first-level spells would not function. This applied to [[divine magic]] and the powers of the gods as well. Therefore, this ring around the center of the plane became a meeting place, bazaar, and common ground used by every intelligent species of the Outer Planes including [[greater deity|greater deities]] of differing alignments. Moving in closer to the center, at about {{SI|100|mi|k|long=yes}}, all chemical reactions ceased to function and even the gods could not get any closer to the center of the plane.

The [[Astral Plane]] connected to the plane of the Outlands by [[color pool]]s, which were never closer than {{SI|600|mi|k|long=yes}} from each other.

The Outlands connected to all the other [[Outer Planes]] via portals. According to one early scholar, these sixteen ''[[portal]]s'' were always seen as white disks of various sizes laid into the ground and were found at the {{SIAdj|1000|mi|k}} mark in a ring around the center of the plane. Each disk could send travelers to any plane they concentrated on. If a group used the ''portal'', the destination was determined by the majority. Beings of a chaotic nature would sometimes be taken to the wrong destination.

Gate-Towns.Excelsior: : A beautiful, well-defended city with a kind population, it connected to [[Mount Celestia]].
Gate-Towns.Tradegate: : A star-shaped city that bristled with commerce and constant activity, it connected to [[Bytopia]] via a complex trade system with a [[bariaur]] known as the [[Master Trader]].
Gate-Towns.Ecstasy: : A peaceful, pastoral town, it connected to [[Elysium]].
Gate-Towns.Faunel: : A ruined city, but bristling with life, it connected to the [[Beastlands (plane)|Beastlands]].
Gate-Towns.Sylvania: : A constantly partying town where music played day and night, it connected to [[Arborea]].
Gate-Towns.Glorium: : A fishing village built at the edge of a fjord, it connected to [[Ysgard]] via two different ''portals''. Another branch of Yggdrasil led to a cavern near the city.
Gate-Towns.Xaos (gate-town)|Xaos: : Also known as aXos, sXoa, oasX, and all other permutations, it was an ever-changing city that connected to [[Limbo]].
Gate-Towns.Bedlam: : A fan-shaped town built haplessly on the slopes of the [[Maurash]] hill, it connected to [[Pandemonium]].
Gate-Towns.Plague-Mort: : A diseased, ruined, and decaying town, it connected to the [[Abyss]].
Gate-Towns.Curst (gate-town)|Curst: : A bleak, dusty city organized in rings, it connected to [[Carceri]].
Gate-Towns.Hopeless: : A large city with a single entrance and organized as a spiral, it connected to [[Hades]].
Gate-Towns.Torch (gate-town)|Torch: : Built on the slopes of a range of volcanoes and surrounded by a disease-ridden marsh, it connected to [[Gehenna]].
Gate-Towns.Ribcage: : A mid-sized settlement, beautiful, but oppressive, located at the bottom of the [[Vale of the Spine]], it connected to the [[Nine Hells]].
Gate-Towns.Rigus: : A huge military encampment, it connected to [[Acheron]].
Gate-Towns.Automata: : A perfectly ordered city, it connected to [[Mechanus]].
Gate-Towns.Fortitude: : A mid-sized, well-ordered city with an oppressive population eager to enforce the law, it connected to [[Arcadia]].

Notable Locations.Realms:
* [[Annam All-Father]] of the [[giant]]s maintained his [[Hidden Realm]], a crystal tower on top a mountain noone could find, during his exile from [[Gudheim]].<ref><ref>
* [[Asgorath]] was believed to lair in the Outlands under his name of Io by some planar scholars,<ref> while their Torilian colleagues maintained the location of his realm could not be pinpointed within the Outer Planes,<ref> or at all.<ref><ref>
* [[Dugmaren Brightmantle]] of the [[Morndinsamman]] resided in [[Soot Hall]] within the [[Dwarvish Mountain]].<ref>
* [[Dumathoin]] of the [[dwarven]] pantheon once had a large underground realm called [[Deepshaft Hall]] that reached almost to the center.<ref>
* [[Eadro]] of the [[merfolk]] and [[locathah]] lived in a huge sea outside the ring of portals.
* [[Gond]] the Wonderbringer once had a realm called [[Wonderhome]] here.
* [[Gzemnid]], the Gas Giant of the [[beholder]]s, kept [[Gzemnid's Realm|his realm]] of tunnels close to that of Ilsensine.
* [[Ilsensine]], greater god of the [[mind flayer|Illithids]], once had its base, the [[Caverns of Thought]], here.
* [[Null]], [[Draconic pantheon|draconic deity]] of judgement, had a realm named the [[Mausoleum of Chronepsis]] in his aspect of the Guardian of the Lost here, with some link to the [[Negative Energy plane]], the [[Plane of Shadow]] and the [[Mausolem of Pain]] on [[Carceri]].
* [[Oghma]] the Binder, patron of [[bard]]s and god of knowledge, had a realm named the [[House of Knowledge (plane)|House of Knowledge]] close to the center of the plane where he maintained a prison for trouble-makers, usually demons and devils.
* [[Semuanya]] of the [[lizardfolk]] once had a realm in [[Semuyana's Bog|a large swamp]] that bordered the sea of Eadro.
* [[Sheela Peryroyl]] had a farm and orchard together named [[Flowering Hill]] here.<ref><ref>
*[[Shekinester]], the three-aspected deity of the [[naga]]s, made her [[Court of Light]] in the Outlands.<ref>
* [[Silvanus]] Oak Father and his Celtic brethren once controlled a large area named [[Tir na Og]] outside the ring of portals.
* [[Thoth]] of the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]] maintained [[Thoth's Estate|homes]] both inside and outside the ring of portals.<ref>
* [[Ubtao]], Creator of [[Chult]], had his primary realm here, the [[Labyrinth of Life]].<ref>
* [[Untamo]] had his [[Sleeping Lands]] here.<ref><ref>
* [[Vergadain]], dwarven god of wealth and luck, once made his home, [[Strongale Hall]], here.<ref>
* [[Waukeen]], Liberty's Maiden and Merchants' Friend, once had her realm, the [[Marketplace Eternal]], here.
* [[Zorquan]], the Greatest Wyrm, was believed by many to reside somewhere in the Outlands, while others thought he lived on the [[Prime Material plane]].<ref>

document_data.Inhabitants: Although the Outlands had no known native species or races, members of all intelligent species could be found here meeting in dead magic zones, trading goods, or traveling between planes, often in service to the higher powers. All manner of [[demon]]s, [[devil]]s, spirit legions, [[einheriar]], [[planetar]]s, [[deva]]s, [[rilmani]] and [[slaad]]i could be found here, for example.
